data.title: Meeting in Infinity by John Kessel, First Edition
data.meta_description: MEETING IN INFINITY . by Kessel, John and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. 1st Edition. A near fine copy in fine mylar protected jacket. Previous owner's info inked to front pastedown and partially hidden by flap. This is the only noted fault.

First edition. Octavo, cloth. The author's first collection of short fiction. Introduction and fourteen stories including "Another Orphan," winner of the 1983 Nebula award. A fine copy in a fine dust jacket. (22694).

First edition. Octavo, cloth. The author's first collection of short fiction. Introduction and fourteen stories including "Another Orphan," winner of the 1983 Nebula award. A fine copy in a fine dust jacket. (28662).

First edition. Octavo, cloth. 3547 copies printed. The author's first collection of short fiction. Introduction and fourteen stories including "Another Orphan," winner of the 1983 Nebula award. [Reference: Anatomy of Wonder (1995) 4-228. See Anatomy of Wonder (2004) II-593]. A fine copy in fine dust jacket. (#169011) (29731).

Octavo, cloth. First edition. 3547 copies printed. The author's first collection of short fiction. Introduction and fourteen stories including "Another Orphan," winner of the 1983 Nebula award. Anatomy of Wonder (1995) 4-228. See Anatomy of Wonder (2004) II-593. A fine copy in fine dust jacket. (#169011).

Octavo, cloth. First edition. 3547 copies printed. The author's first collection of short fiction. Introduction and fourteen stories including "Another Orphan," winner of the 1983 Nebula award. Anatomy of Wonder (1995) 4-228. See Anatomy of Wonder (2004) II-593. A fine copy in fine dust jacket. (#93453).

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. Potter, J.K. (illustrator). First edition. Collects fourteen of Kessel's stories. "At once erudite and witty, Kessel has a particular genius for literary pastiche." Quoted from Barron; Anatomy of Wonder 4, 4-228. Dust jacket illustration by Edvard Munch. Interior illustration by J.K. Potter. Fine in fine and bright dust jacket. An as new copy. Book.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine in Near Fine dust jacket. First Edition. Collects 15 stories. Fine copy in Dust Wrapper [but with a manufacturing defect, 1/8" deep surface chipping, across the top of the spine head. bx101, 6.

Hardcover. Illustrated by Potter, J. K. (illustrator). First Edition. Black cloth stamped in gold on the spine. Comes with a short autograph letter signed by John Kessel. Collects fourteen stories including Another Orphan, which won the 1982 Nebula Award for best novella. Introduction by the author. Illustrations by J. K. Potter. Two small smudges to the fore edge of two of the leaves else a bright, fine copy in fine dustjacket. ; Octavo; Signed by Author.

Octavo, cloth. First edition. A presentation with a warm inscription by Kessel to influential F&SF critic, editor and publisher David G. Hartwell on the half title page: "For David --- / Relentlessly literate, / another brother of the secret / doctorhood, wit, bon vivant, / terrible singer with panache, / and sometimes he even is / right . / With affection, / John / 20 Nov 194." 3547 copies printed. The author's first collection of short fiction. Introduction and fourteen stories including "Another Orphan," winner of the 1983 Nebula award. Anatomy of Wonder (1995) 4-228. See Anatomy of Wonder (2004) II-593. A fine copy in nearly fine dust jacket with tiny nick at upper spine end and a short rub along rear flap fold. (#154961).
